about.metaDesc: ANERITA is a patient‑first emergency ID that shows and speaks your critical info — even offline.
about.title: About ANERITA
about.lede: ANERITA is a patient‑first emergency identification system that shows — and speaks — the essentials when seconds matter. It works online or offline, in any country.
about.missionText: Help responders act faster and safer by giving them clear, consent‑driven information — allergies, conditions, meds, and care preferences — in seconds, in their language.

why.clarity_html: Clarity in chaos: emergency decisions are made fast. We surface what’s critical first.
why.privacy_html: Privacy by design: your data lives on your device unless you choose to share it.
why.global_html: Global by default: big text + voice + translations to bridge language barriers.

safety.device_html: On‑device first: emergency card works offline; optional cloud features later.
safety.tracking_html: Zero tracking: no analytics cookies; we use privacy‑friendly telemetry only when you opt‑in.
safety.consent_html: Consent & control: you decide what shows on scan, and who sees what.

about.safetyNote: Compliance roadmap: UK GDPR baseline; HIPAA alignment for any U.S. hosting/integrations; ISO 27001 practices as we scale.
about.privacyTrustText: ANERITA follows GDPR (Europe) and HIPAA (US) principles. Your data never leaves your device unless you choose to share it. No trackers, no ads, no third‑party data mining.
about.onDeviceText: Unlike cloud‑only apps, ANERITA works offline and caches securely. This ensures responders can access your critical info even without signal.
about.fromPatientText: ANERITA was created by a patient who experienced how hard it is to be heard during emergencies. This tool exists so your voice and wishes are clear when you can’t speak.

privacy.metaDesc: We don’t track you. Your data stays on your device unless you share it.

clinician.metaDesc: How to use ANERITA in the field: fast access, voice playback, offline ready.
clinician.title: Clinician & responder information
clinician.lede_html: ANERITA is a patient‑owned emergency card that displays and speaks time‑critical information at the scene — even without signal.
clinician.accessBody_html: Scan the QR code on the patient’s tag/phone, or tap the widget. The card opens instantly; tap Play to hear the voice summary.

whatList.ids: Identifiers (name, DOB), allergies, key conditions, medications.
whatList.ice: ICE contacts (In Case of Emergency) and patient notes.
whatList.langTriage_html: Language/translation aid and triage color indicator selected by the user.

clinician.offlineBody: The emergency card is cached on the device. If there’s no network, the screen and voice still work. No login required at scene.
clinician.verifyBody: The card is patient‑supplied information. If clinical risk is high or details conflict, verify against secondary sources (wristband labels, medication boxes, GP records, Summary Care Record, EHR, or next‑of‑kin).

verifyBullets.crossCheck_html: Cross‑check: scan tag + confirm name/DOB with patient or ICE contact when possible.

privacyBullets.noTrack: No trackers. Data is stored on the patient’s device; sharing happens only when they or a guardian present the card.
privacyBullets.consent: Use for direct care in emergencies under standard consent exceptions where applicable.
privacyBullets.noPhotos: Do not photograph the card unless local policy allows and it is necessary for care.

clinician.disclaimer: ANERITA is an information aid, not a medical record. Clinical judgment remains paramount.
clinician.docBullet: That a patient‑provided emergency card was consulted (ANERITA).
